title: Creating a reading list that covers a range of methods in machine reasoning within the NLP field is a great way to understand the breadth and depth of the topic. Hereâ€™s a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that cover various approaches
note: including probabilistic, symbolic, and other methods:

title: BERT: Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding" by Jacob Devlin et al
Attention is All You Need" by Ashish Vaswani et al
Variational Inference: A Review for Statisticians
Neural Variational Inference for Text Processing" by Yishu Miao et al
A Survey of Symbolic AI Approaches for Natural Language Processing" by various authors
Compositional Semantics with Lexicalized Tree Adjoining Grammar" by Srinivas Bangalore and Aravind K
Learning to Reason: End-to-End Module Networks for Visual Question Answering" by Jacob Andreas et al
Neural-Symbolic Learning and Reasoning: A Survey and Interpretation
DeepProbLog: Neural Probabilistic Logic Programming" by Robin Manhaeve et al
Neural-Symbolic VQA: Disentangling Reasoning from Vision and Language Understanding" by Peng Wang et al
Graph Neural Networks: A Review of Methods and Applications" by Jie Zhou et al
Graph Convolutional Networks for Text Classification" by Yao et al
Reasoning with Heterogeneous Graph Alignment Networks for Visual Question Answering" by Daqing Liu et al
A Survey on Knowledge Graphs: Representation, Acquisition, and Applications" by Fei Zhu et al
Knowledge Graph Embedding: A Survey of Approaches and Applications
Commonsense Knowledge Mining from Pretrained Models" by Antoine Bosselut et al
**Cognitive and Logical Methods:**
Cognitive Architectures: Research Issues and Challenges" by Pat Langley et al
Logical Neural Networks" by Luciano Serafini and Artur d'Avila Garcez
A Survey of Cognitive Architectures in Natural Language Processing" by various authors
Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI): Concepts, Taxonomies, Opportunities and Challenges toward Responsible AI" by Daniele Gunning et al
The Role of Context in Neural Language Models" by Felix Hill et al

These articles provide a comprehensive overview of different methods and approaches in machine reasoning within NLP. They cover foundational concepts, recent advancements, and various applications, offering a well-rounded understanding of the field
